episode_title: 122 - The One With the Ick Factor

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tell him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Tell him, tell him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just…please tell him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tell me what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at you, you won’t even look at him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on tell me. I could use another reason why women won’t look at me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, all right, all right. Last night, I had a dream that, uh, you and I, were…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Doing it on this table. (points at the table)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Exellent dream score.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why, why, why would you dream that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: More importantly, was I any good?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you were pretty damn good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Interesting, cause in my dreams, I’m allways surprisingly inadequate. (Monica pats him on his lap)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, last night you seemed to know your way around the table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I love it, when we share.
(Ross goes over to the counter. Chandler follows him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re okay there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t belive you two had sex in her dream.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, it was a one-time-thing. I was very drunk and i was somebody else’s subconscious.

content.description: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Chandler is sitting on the table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get off.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, uh, gimme. Can you see me operating a drill press?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. What are you wearing?
(Chandler, Monica and Phoebe looks at him)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, why would you want to operate a drill press?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just for some short-term-work. You know, until I get back some of my massage clients.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pirates again?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, nothing like that. I was just…such a dummie. I taught this “massage-yourself-at-home-workshop.” And they are.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, Chan. She could work for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks Joey, that’s a good idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What… I could, I could do it. What is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, my secretary is gonna be out for a couple of weeks. She is having one of her boobs redused. (Ross looks at her.) It’s a whole big boob story.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I could be a secretary.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you know Phoebs. I don’t know if it’s your kinda thing, because it involves a lot of being normal. For a large portion of the day.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I could do that.
(Ross’s beeper goes off)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you playing with?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it’s my new beeper.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the hell does a paleontologist need a beeper for?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it like for dinosaur emergencies. ‘Help, come quick, they’re still extinct.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s for when Carol goes into labor. She can get me wherever I am. I mean, all she has to do is to dial 55-JIMBO.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A cool phone number, and a possible name for the kid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ll see you guys later. (raises)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Off to see young Ethan?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How young is young Ethan? Young?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s… our age.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When we were?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, he’s a senior in college.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: College?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa! And this manchild has no problem with how old you are?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, of course not. It’s not even an issue. Cause I told him I was 22.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I can’t pass for 22?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe 25-26.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am 26.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There you go.

content.description: Chandler’s office, he and Phoebe are there when the phone starts ringing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you hear that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See that’ll stop when you pick up the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Uh, I’m on. (picks up the phone)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mr. Bing’s office. (Listens) No I’m sorry, he’s in a meeting right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not in a meeting. I’m right… Whoops.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Will he know what this is in reference to? (Listens) And he has your number? (Listens) All right, I’ll see that he gets the message. Bye bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross says hi.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is so fun. All right, what do we do now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, now, I actually have to get to work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Most likely. (raises and goes toward the door) Okay, I’m gonna be out there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Bye bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye bye.
(The intercom buzzes)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whatcha doin’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh. (leans against the desk)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are there. Monica is just finishing cleaning the windows.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Windows are clean, candels are lit. Uh, belt’s to tight, gotta change the belt. Did I turn the fish? (goes over to the kitchen to check on the dinner) No, cause I made lasagne. (to Rachel) Am I out of control?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just a touch. Mon, I don’t understand. I mean, you’ve been dating this guy since like, what… his midterms? I mean, why all the sudden are you so… Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Could tonight be the Night?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. Look he’s a great guy and I love being with him but… you know. Things happen, and they happen. You don’t plan these things.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, did you shave your legs?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A-ha!

content.description: Central Perk. Joey and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Would you let it go Ross. It was just a dream. It doesn’t mean…
(Ross’s beeper goes off)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh. Oh, oh. Oh this is it. Oh my god it’s baby time. Baby time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, relax, relax. Just relax, just relax. Be cool, be cool.
(Ross dials a number on his cellular phone)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, hi, I was just beeped. (pause) No, Andr� is not here. (to Joey) Third time today. (on phone) Yes, I’m sure… No, sir. I don’t perform those kind of services.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Services? (Ross looks at him) Oh, services.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you want 55-JUMBO. Yeah, that’s right. That’s right, JUMBO with a U, sir. (pause) No, belive me, you don’t want me. Judging by his number, I’d be a huge disappointment. (pause) All rightie, bye bye.
(Phoebe and Chandler enter)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey. How was the first day?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, exellent. Everyone was so, so nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, it pays to know the man who wears my shoes. (Joey and Ross wonder what he means) Me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I didn’t tell anybody that I knew you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, because, you know… they don’t like you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I thought you knew that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noho. Who doesn’t they like me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everyone. Except for uh… no everyone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t feel bad. You know they used to like you a lot. But then you got promoted, and, you know, now you’re like “Mr. Boss Man”. You know, Mr. Bing. Mr. Bing, “Boss Man Bing”.
(Joey and Ross laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t belive it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah. They even do you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They do me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know like… uh okay… uh… ‘Could that report be any later?’
(Joey and Ross laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t sound like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh Chandler…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh… Yeah, you do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘The hills were alive with the sound of music.’
(Phoebe, Joey and Ross laughs)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My scones.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘ My scones.’
(Phoebe, Joey and Ross laughs again)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I don’t sound like that. That is so not true.
(Joey and Chandler laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is so not … That is so not … That… Oh, shut up!
(Phoebe, Joey and Ross laugh)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Young Ethan are sitting in the couch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did not.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: I am telling you, up until I was, like nine, I thought that gunpoint was an actual place where crimes happen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How was that possible?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Well, think about it. It’s always on the news. ‘A man is being held up, at gunpoint.’ ‘Tourists are being terrorised, at gunpoint.’ And I just kept thinking: why does people continue to go there? (He checks his watch.) Oh, ah. I should go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
(They kiss)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Unless…

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, ah. Unless you wanna stay over? I mean, I’m going to, so…

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Yeah, I’d really like that.
(They kiss)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Uuh, before we get into any staying-over-stuff, there is something you should know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, is this like ‘I have an early class tomorrow’ or ‘I’m secretly married to a goat?’

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Well it’s somewhere in between. You see, in a strictly technical sense, of course, I’m not uh…, well I, I mean I haven’t ever uh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ethan?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you a virgin?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Well, if that’s what you kids are calling it these days then, yes I am. I uh, I’ve kinda been waiting for the right person.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Yeah. You do know I was talking about you, right?
(They kiss)
[Time lapse. They are now in Monica’s bedroom, on the bed.]

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You keep saying that.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: You know, you read about it, you see it in the movies. Even when you practice it at home, man oh man, it is nothing like that.
(They kiss)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen, uh, you told me something that was really difficult for you. And I, I-I figured if you could be honest, then I can to.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Oh god, don’t tell me, I did it wrong.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no. Nothing wrong about that.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, okay, here it goes. I’m not 22. I’m, I’m 25… and thirteen months.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Huh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I figured, you know, that shouldn’t change anything. I mean, what the hell does it matter how old we are.
(They kiss)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Uh, listen um, as long as we’re telling stuff, uh, I have another one for you. I’m a little younger than I said.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not a senior?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Oh, I’m a senior… in High School.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok…ay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What we did was wrong. Oh god, I just had sex with somebody that wasn’t alive during the Bicentennial.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: I just had sex.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ethan, focus. How could you not tell me?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Well, you never told me how old you were.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, that’s different. My lie didn’t make one of us a felon in 48 states. What were you thinking?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: I wasn’t thinking. I was too busy fallin’…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t say it. (closes Ethan’s mouth with her hand)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: …in love with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well,fall out of it. You know, you shouldn’t even be here, it’s a school night. Oh god, oh god. I’m like those women that you see with shiny guys named Chad. I’m Joan Collins.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Who?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone exept Monica is there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Andr� should be there in like 45 minutes. All rightie, bye bye. (to Phoebe) Just easier that way.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on. You told me about the last dream.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, forget it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, why not. Was I doing anything particularly… saucy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, fine. Um, you were not the only one there. (Camera fades to Ross, who’s listening very carefully) Joey was there too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. (Moves closer.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Was there…uh, huh, huh, huh… andybody, anybody else there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re sure? Nobody uh, handed out uh, mints or anything?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it was just the three of us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, tell me. Was it like you and Chandler, and then you and me, or you and me and Chandler?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There were times when it wasn’t even me.
(Chandler and Joey laughs, until they look at each other then recoil in horror.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so sweet, you guys. (hugs them)
(Monica enters, wearing a walkman, so she doesn’t hear what the others say)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Mon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon, Ethan called again. Mon?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Mon!
(Monica takes of her walkman)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ethan called again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you not seeing him anymore?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. You know, sometimes just things doesn’t work out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And this has nothing to do with the fact that he needs a note to get out of gym.
(Monica stares at Rachel)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I, I didn’t say any… I sw… I did not say anything, I swear. He stopped by.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, the next time you talk to him, can you ask him which one the strongest Power Ranger is?
(Ross and Chandler laughs)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ha,ha, ha, oh my life is just so amusing. Could we drop it now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s morphin time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Stegosaurus!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tyrannosaurus!
(They all cross they’re arms like the Power Rangers do)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, oh, I’ve gotta go. (raises) Whoa, oh, head rush. One more, and then I have to go. (sits down, and then raises again) Cool!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where are you going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, oh, I’ve got a birthday party, with some work people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Work people? Nobody told me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I know. That’s a part of the whole, you know, them-not-liking-you-extravaganza.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I don’t get this. A month ago, these people were my friends. You know, just because I’m in charge doesn’t mean I’m a different person.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, then you should come tonight. You know, just hang out with them. Let them see what a great guy you still are.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You think I should?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I really do, yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, but, could we not go together? I,I don’t wanna be the geek that invited the boss.

content.description: Chandler’s office, he and Phoebe are taking a break from work.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I Think last night was great. You know, the Karaoke thing. Tracy and I doing Ebony and Ivory .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You were great. But they still made fun of you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, now you’re more like, you know like, “Mr. Caring Boss,” “Mr.”, you know, “I’m one of you, Boss,” “Mr., I wanna be your buddy, Boss Man Bing!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then, I don’t get it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you know what Chandler? I think you’ve gotta face it. You’re like, the guy in the big office, you know. You’re the one that hires them, that fires them… They still say you’re a great boss.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh huh. But they’re not your friends anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just wan’t to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but you can’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I just wa…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh uh.

content.description: Central Perk. Everyone exept Phoebe and Chandler is there. Ross’s beeper goes off and everyone exept him react.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aren’t you gonna…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, Carol and I have a new system. If she punches in 911, it means she’s having a baby, otherwise I just ignore it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about Andr�?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, well this morning he got a call from who I think was our cousin Nathan, and frankly, it was a little more than I needed to know.
(Ethan enters)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was gonna be my opener.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, did you guys check out those new hand-dryers in the bathroom?
content.parenthetical: understands that Monica and Ethan wanna be alone

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I thought that was just a rumour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: True story.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re here already?
(Rachel, Ross and Ross go to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: All right, look. I’ve gotta tell you something. I’m not 17. I only said so that you’d think I was cute and vunerable. I’m actually 30, I have a wife, I have a job, I’m your Congressman. Monica, this is ridiculous, we’re great together. We can talk, we make each other laugh, and the sex. Oh, man, okay i have no frame of graft, but I thought that was great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Then, what’s the problem?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ethan, it’s um… it’s icky.

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: Icky? You’re actually gonna throw this away because it’s icky?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This isn’t easy for me either. I wish things were different, I… If you were a few years older, or if I was a few years younger, or if we lived in biblical times, I would really…

content.speaker: Young Ethan
content.text: No, don’t say it. (closes Monica’s mouth with his hand)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …love you.
(Ross, Rachel and Joey come back from the bathroom. They discover that Monica and Ethan aren’t finished talking to each other yet.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you’re hands still wet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, moist, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let’s dry ’em again.
(They go to the bathroom again)

content.description: A hall on the floor where Chandler works. Chandler and Phoebe enters, and overhears some employees’s conversation. One of them is doing Chandler.

content.speaker: Gerston
content.text: Uh, like, could these margaritas be any stronger? (They discover that Chandler is listening) Hey, Chandler.

content.speaker: Santos
content.text: Hello, Mr. Bing.

content.speaker: Petrie
content.text: Loved your Stevie Wonder last night.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. Listen, about the weekly numbers, I’m gonna need them on my desk by nine o’clock.

content.speaker: Santos
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Gerston
content.text: No problem.
(They go away, trying very hard not to laugh at Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You have to give ’em something, you know. Okay, now that was Gerston, Santos, and who’s the guy with the moustache?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Petrie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Petrie, right, right. Okay, some people gonna be working this weekend.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is watching TV, but turns it off, and Rachel is sleeping on the couch. Ross puts a blanket over her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooooooooh. (Rachel strokes her hand over the pillow. Ross mimicks her silently) Oh, that’s nice. Oh, oh. Huh, Ross!
(Ross gets all excited and starts to dance on the coffee table, but slips allmost immediatly, and falls onto the couch. Rachel wakes up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are. Well, um… We, we, we were just… Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (his beeper goes off) Great, now I’m having a baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh, Ooh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m having… I’m having a baby. (jumps back onto the table again) I’m having a… Where’s the phone? The phone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know where the phone is.
(Ross runs from the table, over the couch but slips and falls onto the floor)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m hurt.

content.description: The Hallway, Ross is eagerly waiting for the others to get ready, to go to the hospital.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, let’s go. Come on now people, woman in labor.
(Chandler struts out from his apartment)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Ross, look what I’ve got going here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, save it for the cab, okay.
(Rachel comes out from their apartment with a mirror and a lipstick in her hands)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you doing? We’re going to a hospital.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, so I can’t lokk nice? There might be doctors there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, get out of the fridge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right. (he comes out from their apartment with a huge sandwich in his hand)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is that? (refering to the sandwich)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: For the ride.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, like in a cab…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Save it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, hating this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, come on now. Let’s go, baby coming.
(Monica enters from their apartment, crying)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t belive it, I’m gonna be an aunt. I’m gonna have like a nephew.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s nice. Get out Let’s go, come on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’m going. I’m going.
(They all go down the stairs, but Ross turns around, looking like his in a coma. The others also turns around to get him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here we go, here we go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rossy, Rossy.
